intro: Lycoseris retroflexa, commonly known as the retroflex lycosere, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open woodlands, thriving in well-drained soils. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a flat-topped cluster, and bloom during the warmer months. Lycoseris retroflexa is often found in disturbed habitats and can be an indicator of ecological change in its environment.
